text: Dark brown pour with a khaki head and spotty lacing. Aroma is berries, chocolate, char, caramel, and bourbon. Taste is sweet berry and fruit, dark chocolate, bourbon, sweet caramel, and fruity. Full body.
Bottle thanks to Bill. Pours dark brown with h no head. Pear, peach, mole chocolate. Very sweet, medium mouthfeel. Low carbonation.

Bottle 0.66l sample at Ratebeer Belgian Winter Gathering 2017 Antwerp, Belgium at Beerlovers Bar 25.02.2017. Thanks everybody for sharing great beers! Pour it dark color with no head. Aroma kick of molasis and ginger. Taste roasted coffee beans, apricot, spices, dark chocolate, molasis, wheat, woody note, vanilla, nice sweet after taste, medium sweetness, full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish. Good!
Great combination of flavours. Starts sweet, with sour and bitter notes taking over. Long length.
Geproefd @ RBBWG2017. Kleur is zwart-bruin met kleine witte schuimkraag. Geur is kokosnoot, zoet en een tikkeltje vanille. Smaak is fruitig, een tikkeltje kokosnoot, zoet en licht bitter.

25/II/17 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle @ RBBWG (Beerlovers Bar, Antwerpen) - BB: n/a (2017-221) Thanks to sebletitje for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark brown beer, irregular beige head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: vanilla, sweet, caramel, bit sugary, dried fruits, some chocolate. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet, bit roasted, caramel, vanilla, alcohol, bit sourish, more alcohol, bitter touch. Aftertaste: bit sourish, alcohol, roasted, some honey, bitter touch, dried fruits.

Black body with a reddish-brown ring of head. The bouquet is decidedly bourbon and vanilla with smooth roastyness well-faded into the background. The body is richly flavored with coconut, some residual bourbon notes, smooth roastiness, and strong dose of butterscotch. Smooth drinker for the ABV %.

Bouteille via trade with Ibrew2or3. Cheers Dave. BB after 7/20/2016.
Brune assez foncé, au col beige.
Arôme au nez malté, caramel, toffee pas mal de fruité noir et un rétro fort plaisant de pêche. Petite pointe de poudre de cacao perçant en rétro-nasal. Le Bourbon est assez discret, et je note peu le côté boisé et vanillé.
Palais est malté, caramel, toffee avec une certaine épaisseur en bouche et une pointe de fleuri arrivant en retrait. Purée dabricot voire de pêche complète cette bière fortement centrée sur les malts.
Le Bourbon reste très fin et apporte une petite rondeur et douceur vanillée sans vraiment être le trait arquant de ce porter.
Always have enjoyed this series. Strong roasted malt with chocolate, berry, molasses, some spice and whiskey. Slight oak sweetness. Nice color and feel.

Sampled at the RBBWG2017 . Thnx for sharing, everyone ! Pours black/brown, small white head. Smell is full, sharp, bit fruity. Sweet, dark malts. Taste is full, dark malts, mild booze, some fruits. OK .

Cream-ochre head, stable, over near-black beer. Roasted, nuts, bit rust-like, hot metal aroma, chocolate. Roasted, dried fruit, alcohol, fusels, banana. Very well-bodied, alcoholimpression, quite oily-viscous feel. I would have expected more from this. Nowhere bad, but nowhere original flavours neither.

Bomber shared by sebletitje at RBBWG. Moussy, dense but quickly dissolving, brownish pale beige head, black robe with mahogany edges. Aroma of hot chocolate sauce, treacle, chestnut, vanilla, beef stock, caramel, candied banana, natural iron, cappuccino, marmelade, kahlua. Sweet onset, pear syrup and marmelade impressions but balanced by underlying brambleberry-ish sourishness, soft carbo, slick, thick and oily mouthfeel. Nutty, toffeeish malt core gaining more bitter chocolateness as it grows, ending in a mild coffee-like roasted bitter accent, spicy hop bitter punch in the end, leathery and umami flavors linger along with wet wood tannins and the expected bourbon-like alcohol warmth. Quite intense but packed with flavor, tasteful and rich beer, worthy of this brewerys reputation.

Thank you Sebletitje! 650 ml. bottle sampled @ RBBWG VI (2017). Black, lovely creamy mocha head. Nose is bitter licorice, molasses, burned barrel, mocha, roasted malts, herbal bitter. Taste is strongly bitter, herbal, bitter plastic, roast, burned plastic, charred barrel, molasses, licorice. Body is bitter thick plastic molasses. Overly bitter licorice, roast & molasses heavy for me. I got absolutely zero apricot puree here, bourbon seems lost underneath the bitterness as well. Not what I hoped for.

22oz bottle picked up at the state store 
Pours dark brown with a medium sized tan head, some lacing. Aroma of cocoa, chocolate, dark fruit and bourbon. Flavor of chocolate, dark fruit, molasses vanilla , bourbon and spices 
Good, but its not as good as other years. Surprisingly, it is a little thin.
Very dark brown pour. Aroma whiskey, slight tangy fruit, slight sweetness. Tastes slight rose, burnt barley, dark choco. I like this combination a lot more compared to XXVI.

Bottle. It poured a black color with a tan head. The aroma was of bourbon, oak, vanilla, chocolate, bread and some spice. The taste was similar to the aroma with more bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, spice and molasses. It had a medium to full body with a nice aftertaste. Good stuff.

DATE: December 27, 2016... OCCASION: just got back from "bowling" with some good friends... GLASSWARE: Duvel tulip... pours a dark black body that supports a one-finger brown head that bubbles and froths while maintaining its integrity... rich, thick cocoa impacts the nostrils, while bourbon, vanilla, cedar, and an aromatic citrus that makes for a full dose... full-bodied, explosive at the teeth and throat, warming and long on the finish--a thick, blanketing mouth feel that is also creamy and drinkable, especially given its ABV... the pomegranate plays prominently in this profile, with cocoa and bourbon infusing each sip with an alcoholic punch... a meal in itself, this beer gets stronger as the glass drains... fruit esters linger with every sip, and its strength holds steady... the bourbon makes its presence known...

Shared 22oz. bottle. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of dark fruit, molasses, bourbon and chocolate. Taste is chocolate, bourbon, oak, molasses, fruit. Gets better as it approaches room temperature.

Aroma: malt, current, some booze; Appearance: pitch black with creamy off white head that lingers; Taste: follows nose with some additional cocoa, bitterness and booziness at the end; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: nice complexity but a little too sweet.

This Black Butte release is, like many of the others, totally weird. Lots of crazy things in here yet he taste is lovely and cohesive. Roast, fruit, and cocoa aromas. Flavor is chocolaty with notes of stone fruit and dry sherry. The booze is tremendously well hidden. For all the added ingredients and the experimental attitude, this Black Butte is marvelously balanced and flavorful.

Bottle.

A- Oak, subtle cherry, bourbon, mild fruit.

A- Black color, dark liquid, light brown head.

T- Oak, subtle bourbon, dark fruits, slightly sweet.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, complex finish.

O- My 3rd in this series. Had 26 fresh and 28 fresh so why not have 27 after the best after date. Drinks nice. Dont really get any pomegranate or apricot or even spice, but it makes for a slightly fruity sweetness. Plenty of oak and maybe even some cherry in there. Nice beer overall. An addition of coffee would really be nice I think.
So this looks great and is a nice sipping beer. The combination of the two fruits makes it a bit too sweet at times but Ive always enjoyed pomegranate in my beer. Solid.

Bottle ~1 year old. Pours dark translucent brown black. Nose is pomegranate molasses (I cook with this a lot), dark roast malts, light vanilla and bourbon. Taste is lightly sour....I would suspect infection if not for the pomegranate molasses. Flavors of dark chocolate, dark and chocolate malts, fig/stewed prunes, with sour pomegranate molasses finish. Probably the worst of this series to date for me.

Sampled from a 22 oz brown bottle this beer poured a black color with a medium sized soapy-foamy brown head that lingered and left a bit of lacing. The aroma was sweet and toasty with notes of chocolate, ripe dark fruits, anise, wood and rum. The flavor was woody with notes of whiskey, anise, fig, cherry and molasses. Noted boozy presence. Long finish of whiskey, anise and dark fruits. Moderately full bodied. Surprisingly smooth.

650ml bottle from Park Royal. Tasted with Ilya. Pours an opaque dark brown with a brown head. Aroma is coffee, cocoa, bourbon barrel, some leather, fruity and grassy notes. Taste is pretty the same, medium to high sweetness level, medium booziness level, with chocolate, molasses, fruity and roasted malt notes. Roasted malt, chocolate aftertaste. Excellent.

Bottle 65 cl. Pours dark brown with a warm, burgundy hue and a light brown head. Bourbon nose, but also a whiff of tartness. Rich, sweet body, some licorice, but subtle roastiness. Has a slight, rustic tartness as somme barrel aged beers get, I wonder if thats why it was blended. But not horrible or anything, just not as smooth as some of the best Bourbon barrel aged beers. 031016

Dark black brown .. Great foam .. Chick a doo? .. Lots of cabinet sweetness, tar, vanilla, roast .. . Solid mouth, throat feels good, mild finish .. 

And suddenly I heard the words I had repressed my entire life just fall out of my mouth, "Yes, Officer. Thats my clown paraphernalia."

Rating #2204  2015.12.01 - #CraftBeerFantasyLeague Battle: Barrel-Aged Beauties  finished 3rd of 9 entries. Pours jet black with a luxurious velvety tan head with excellent retention. Aroma is heavy on vanilla, dark roast coffee, toffee, burnt sugar notes. Coffee flavours throughout, accented by vanilla bean, caramel and brown sugar notes. Exquisite.
Bottle. Brown pour with tan head. Roasted, chocolate, vanilla, oak and bourbon aromas. Flavors are vanilla, oak, roasted, chocolate and bourbon tones.
UPDATED: SEP 14, 2016 Bottle - pours black tan head - nose and taste of bourbon, apricot, molasses cake, chocolate, oak - medium body

22 oz bottle, best after date of 07-20-16- Pours black with a medium light tan head that reduces to a thin blanket and a nice collar. Aroma is pretty typical for the style, dark roasted malts, strong cocoa, a touch of alcohol, wood, molasses, dark fruits, in particular plum. The taste is pretty standard too, the cocoa, tobacco, dark fruits, all trademarks of the style are here, but the pomegranate really adds a nice tartness that sets this one apart, and that tartness follows through to the finish. Mostly standard, but i think this one is slightly more interesting than years past. Drank about half the bottle, and its starting to taste a bit harsh, dont want to dock it too much, but the overall i will reduce from a 17 to a 16, a beer better shared with friends.

Location: On tap at Harrys Hofbrau in Redwood City, CA 
Aroma: Licorice, smoky fruits, burnt but buttery toffee, boozy fruits
Taste: Booze soaked dark fruits (cherries, peaches), bitter dark chocolate and boozy finish.
Palate: Full bodied but not too slick...crisp and tangy
Overall: Very boozy...reminded me mostly of bourbon/brandy soaked cherries with hints of smoke, licorice, burnt fruit.

Bottle), shared at RBAG by me. Dark brown with golden highlights. Dark caramel, chocolate, apricots, a touch boozy with a warming finish and moderate peach-pit bitterness. Nice fruity acidity in the finish.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Thanks to Matt for this enjoyable brew! Liquide très foncé sans pour autant être noir. Mousse discutable laissant des dentelles sur mon verre qui elles, nont rien de discutables. Arômes dun équilibre remarquable où se conjuguent à la perfection le bourbon, le fruit à noyau, un bois vanillé et suintant, le caramel et une mélasse douce et riche. Je ne sens que très peu les épices. Cest ça n bouche que ces dernières prennent véritablement leur envol. En effet, celles-ci occupent une place trop importante à mon goût et tranchent trop agressivement les saveurs crémeuses et équilibrées qui font le reste de la bière. Texture crémeuse presque huileuse véhiculant de la noix, encore du fruit, une note qui me rappelle la fraise des champs et même lérable grâce à la mélasse. Dommage pour la fin de bouche épicées. À min avis, cétait une erreur dajouter des épices dans ce mélange qui eût été absolument génial.

Terrific. Side by side with the XXVI, this version is peppier and more refined. Balanced fruit -- the apricot cuts through the bourbon and chocolate. A little peppery and spicy, complementing the long finish. Likewise rich, with a pine hop profile and a warming quality.
Deep clear brown, aroma is fruity and heavy booze. Caramel and red fruits, heavy alcohol presence, but good.

Bottle to tulip
Consummation: Sour toasted malt, caramel, coffee
Adjunct: Booze, malt, caramel, fruit, and blackberry; medium bodied and oily
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are dark chocolate, coffee, molasses, and some bourbon and dark fruits.
Bomber. Dark oily mahogany pour with a smaller head. Rich aroma and taste - wood, bourbon, roast, molasses, and a sweet fruit note. Great beer.
Poured a darker brown with a beige head. Aroma was of light chocolate, barrel, cola,anddark fruit. Flavor similar, too colalikeandnot hefty.

651 ml. bottle. Best after 7/20/16. ABV 11.6%per the label. Pours a medium, well retained, tiny bubbled, beige head, over a clear dark brown (SRM 25) body......nose is heavy roasted malts, with chocolate, mild coffee, then multiple dried fruits including plum, raisin, light apricot, mild Bourbon whiskey, brown sugar, vanilla, mild herbal hops.....taste is moderately sweet, with molasses, brown sugar tones, mild spice, chocolate and mild coffee from the roasted malts, light apricot, moderate Bourbon whiskey, light oak, mild herbal hop bitterness, balance to the additives, malts and barrel......mouth feel, thick, sticky body, alcohol warmth present, carbonation creates a creamy mouthful. This is a heavy, rich, complex beer. Interestingly each of the components is identifiable and adds to the pleasure. This is not a beer to be drunk in the Utah desert in the summer, but on a winter night it would be utterly marvelous. BJCP 8/3/15/5/8
Pours Black with Tan head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, light cocoa, light woody, choko, sweet notes. Sweet and vanilla.
Bottle thanks to Rainer. Pours black with medium tan head that lasts. The aroma is cocoa, dark fruit, bourbon, wood. Thick body, roast, similar flavors to nose, nice sweetness, dry finish, very good.

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co., and snifter served showing a black/brown hue, with a frothy layer of brownish tan head foam, and web-like cling to the lacing. The nose was creamy malt, roasted, cocoa, dark caramel sweetness, light spice, and a hint of esters as dried fruit. Full bodied, with soft carbonation, the esters in the taste presented more of a dark fruit nature, coupled with a bit of tartness, earthy & roasted astringency, sweetness, and a boozy, but not overbearing, bourbon presence. A robust, birthday sipper, with XXVIII waiting in the wings.

Pours translucent dark brown, almost black with a beige head. Nose has roasted malts, slight sharp jam and some mexican spice. Not much barrel. Taste is roasty with spices. Cinnemon and chili.. Far less jammy than it was a year ago. Aftertaste has dark chocolate, coffee, licorice and mild chili.. Great porter.

22 ounce bottle into snifter, best after 7/20/2016. Pours opaque dark brown/black color with a 1-2 finger dense and rocky khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of big milk chocolate, cocoa, caramel, toffee, molasses, toasted dark bread, raisin, plum, fig, apricot, and cherry; with lighter notes of coffee, smoke, bourbon, oak, vanilla, licorice, char, leather, tobacco, herbal, and roast/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/roast/bready malt, dark fruit, and light-moderate bourbon barrel notes; with great strength. Taste of big milk chocolate, cocoa, caramel, toffee, molasses, toasted dark bread, raisin, plum, fig, apricot, and cherry; with lighter notes of coffee, smoke, bourbon, oak, vanilla, licorice, char, leather, tobacco, herbal, and roast/toasted earthiness. Light-moderate roasted bitterness and light fruit tartness on the finish; with lingering notes of milk chocolate, cocoa, caramel, toffee, molasses, toasted dark bread, dark fruit, apricot, herbal, tobacco, and roast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, dark fruit, and light-moderate bourbon barrel flavors; with a great roasted bitter/sweet and lightly tart balance; with zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light dryness from roast bitterness and fruit tartness, lightly increasing through the glass. Light-medium carbonation and fairly full body; with a very smooth, creamy/silky, lightly sticky/chalky, and slightly acidic balanced mouthfeel that is awesome. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a light warmth lingering after the finish. Overall this is an outstanding barrel aged blended imperial porter style. All around awesome omplexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/bready malt, dark fruit, and light-moderate bourbon barrel flavors; very smooth and easy to sip on for the big ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

Yay, the bottle says I can drink it now, which is necessary on Trump night. Pours a deep black. Thin beige head. Rich dark chocolate aroma with some berries. Dark chocolate, floral, some coffee and pomegranate maybe? Pretty good.

750 ml bottle. Pours black with a resilient beige head. Aroma is wood, chocolate, apricot, fruit, booze. Flavor is chocolate, caramel, roast, apricot. Finish is molasses, pepper, bourbon, some hazelnut. Lingering pomegranate, flower. Full body, velvety mouthfeel and weak to average carbonation. Whoa!

"Oak aged anniversary" on tap at the Deschutes brewpub in Bend.
Black body with a very good light tan head. 
Moderate aroma of sweet malts and whisky barrels Mildly sweet.
Smooth, full body and lively carbonation. 
Overall: disappointing yet better than the 28 Anniv. Butte with which it was paired.

Great tasting stout with a Bourban taste. 
A hint at chocolate and fruit. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from the stash. Very dark brown with a small beige head that fades to a ring pretty quickly. Aroma of chocolate, molasses, bourbon barrel, grass, and indiscernible fruit. Taste is heavily roasty, boozy, bitter, woody and fruity sweet. Medium bodied, smooth, and tinglingly boozy. Good, but definitely not the best of this series.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2016 Dark brown with moderate, creamy tan head. Smells of pomegranate, cocoa, bourbon, and oak. Taste is bourbon first, with molasses, pomegranate, and apricot. I even noticed a little tobacco as it warmed. Thin bodied with light carbonation. Very drinkable.

Aroma is bourbon oak and vanilla right away followed by the dark fruit (pomegranate) and molasses from the description. I am also getting some cocoa in the background. Very dark brown color with a light brown ring on the top. The flavor is strong charred oak barrel which is cut immediately by the fruit and molasses, reverting back to a rich and roasted aftertaste. I thought it would taste stronger, but it is a pleasant drinker for the ABV. The palate is so-so; I find that with a lot of deschutes beers. Overall this was easy to drink and surprisingly good for a summer day, but I think Black Butte has become too highly anticipated of a name brand, causing the rating to be a bit inflated.

Bomber. Extreme punchy stone fruit and chocolate nose. Dark translucent brown color with reddish edges. Very sweet with red fruit, berries, chocolate, and moderate bitterness. Medium body, thick on the tongue in mid and final. Really nicely blended fruit and chocolatey flavors.
Bottle. Nose of molasses, fig or dates, chocolate, huge, rich, funky nose. Huge fruit flavor, raisins, dates, apricot, chocolate, bourbon, vert tart. Great fruit. Very smooth.

15th January 2016Thatll be me 20K then @ ChrisOs. Thanks to Wingman. LIght haze on this amber - brown beer, small pale tan head. Palate is comparatively light, mildly dry and has decent fine carbonation. Tangy rfruits. Spice. Bourbon spice. Bourbon soaked dark fruits. Light finish bring more spice. The dark malt character fairly modest here. Warming afterglow.
Big bottle from Ale arsenal. Lasting brown head. Very intense coffee aroma. Sweet chocolate and coffee taste. .low bitterness and small body.

(Best after: 7/20/16) Un corps brun sans véritable tête. Au nez, je perçois des arômes de poivre ou de piment, de chocolat, de fruits délicats, deau-de-vie brune, de terre. Les saveurs de bourbon et de mélasse me semblent être les éléments qui dominent. Une facette épicée et un fruité non-identifiable font de rapides apparitions. Une sensation de cacao est construite. En bouche, le corps moyen-fort est faiblement touché par les bulles. La texture liquoreuse est rendue possible. La finale complexe de cacao et de notes rôties et dépices et de fleurs et de chaleur de bourbon mapparaît comme salvatrice. Étrange bête cohésive.

650ml bottle from Whole Foods, Seattle, WA. Pours pitch black with a tiny head. Aroma of roasty malts, bourbon, apricot, wood, oak and cocoa nibs. Taste is smooth, slightly roasty and heavy with bourbon, wood, juicy apricot notes, hints of cocoa and vanilla. Finish is heavy and slightly roasty with some sweetish syrup, oak, coffee, cocoa and ripe apricot notes. Quite interesting and different compared to the other ones.

Bottle split at Kenny Zwanzig Kay, thanks to the Wingman, 15/01/16.
Light black with a decent tan covering.
Nose is rich in dark fruit, spice, cocoa powder, jammy red berries, raisens, dark maltings. 
Taste comprises chocolate, roast malt, raspberry jam, light peppery spice, fruit cake.
Medium + body, fine carbonation, sweet rise and a tickle o boost.
Decent enough impy.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Type: 12-oz. draft
Glass: Clear snifter glass (they called it a tulip, who knows?)
From: Main Tap Tavern in El Cajon, Calif.
Price: $7.00
Purchased: June 4, 2016
Consumed: June 4, 2016
Misc.: N/A

Came here specifically for this beer. Had the 23 version and was hoping this would be just as good. Cant remember the details of that one, but I know it was in Spokane and fantastic.

Poured a very dark brown color with 1-to- fingers of fizzy head when I got it. Thinned out rather quickly. A few bubbles were coming up from the bottom. Below, wet lacing. Bad retention. (Sigh - 3.25)

Smelled smooth bourbon, molasses, licorice, dark fruit - purple grape and plum - toffee, caramel, buttery malts, hazelnut and a touch of floral hops. It got a bit boozy late. (Smell - 4.00)

Tasted close to the smell, but better. Got smooth bourbon, rich molasses, hazelnut, caramel, toffee, dark cocoa, black licorice, cold pressed black coffee, espresso, vanilla, plum and chocolate syrup. (Taste - 4.25)

Full body. Sticky texture. Average carbonation. Long, smooth, warming finish. (Feel - 4.75)

This one got better as it warmed as most boozy beers do. Not as good as XXIII that I had a few years back, but good. (Overall - 4.25)

4.18 93 A-
Brown.small tan head.Overly sweet alcoholic nose.Sweet boozy palate,medium roast. Too sweet, too boozy. Sadly, this has seriously gone downhill since the XX version

On tap. poured an opaque blackish color with a thick head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, dark fruit and bit of spice. Taste of roasted malt, dark chocolate, some dark fruit. Subtle bitterness and a dry finish. Full body, thick and creamy with a robust character that lasts throughout. Very enjoyable beer to relax with.

Aroma is chocolate/dark chocolate, fruit, spices and pizza crust. The flavor is chocolate/dark chocolate, fruit, mild tropical fruit, dark malts, spices and a long and mild alcohol/bourbon/mildly sweet finish.

Pours an opaque dark brown color with khaki colored head. Chocolate, spice, sweetness, dark fruits, and some light whiskey tones on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium to full bodied. Finishes with chocolate and sweetness.
Bottle. Pours jet black with small creamy brown head. Aroma of roasted malt and chocolate. Sweet flavor with cocoa accents. Full bodied with creamy texture. Very good.

Bottle share. Pours a deep dark black/brown with a small foamy off-white head. Aromas of dark fruits, smoke, chocolate, some molasses. Flavor was smokey up front, kind of like bacon, woody, chocolate, dark fruit, molasses. Fule body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, touch of warming bourbon on the finish.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2017 From SF, Pours black color, clear, with light brown foamy head. Visually low carbonation. Aroma: intense and rich aroma of additives, like Apricot, Pomegranate molesses, supported with dark malts, chocolate, cocoa nibs, bourbon, vanilla, oak, and reisiny, floral, spicy note of hops. Flavor is very similar: rich dark/chocolate malt flavor, supported with chocolate coca nibs, apricot, with hint of Pomegranate molasses...bourbon note is gentle noticeable in the background, like notes of vanilla and hops. Taste is sweet, alcohol warmth is gentle (my girlfriend said is max 8% abv.!), finish is sticky, dry. Body is medium to high, texture is silky smooth, carbonation is low. Another great brew from Deschutes!

Bomber poured a clear dark reddish brown with a lasting creamy tan head. Aromas of bakers cocoa, fruitiness, spice, oak and light bourbon. Palate was medium to full bodied with a smooth dry finish. Flavors of dark chocolate, fruitiness, spice, oak, light vanilla and a hint of bourbon with a smooth dry lingering fruity chocolate finish.

Poured from 1 pint 6 fl oz bottle [best after 7/20/16 - so a little early]. Dark black with tan head. Leathery molasses aroma with fruity texture. Taste of light apricot and pomegranate, chocolate, hint of ash and alcohol. Prefer older editions, but perhaps some aging will improve the next bottle of this.

Bottle shared at Kennys 20k tasting - London. Cheers to Dave for bringing this one. Pours deep brown with a frothy, tan head. The aroma holds cocoa, dark fruits and scorched earth. Medium to heavy sweet flavour, lightly gooey, with earthy bitterness, bittersweet cocoa, charred wood, dried fruits. Full bodied and chewy, with fine carbonation. Warming finish, sugary, with continuing earthy bitterness, chocolate. Some chalky texture in the aftertaste. Good stuff overall, just a bit too heavy hitting.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2016 Aromas of rich chocolate, molasses, vanilla, and dark fruits, smells really decadent. Mouth is full and its pretty smooth from the lack of carbonation. Flavors mirror the aromas, rich and tasty. Never really found the apricots though, still nice.

Re-try, aged. 12/3/16. The barrel attributes were rather pronounced, practically masking other flavors. Although I was able to find the apricot this time. Still pretty good, but I think that I liked it better fresh.

22 oz bottle. Dark brown with tan froth. Nose is cocoa, molasses, bourbon, cayenne, raisin and earthy spice. Silky, warming medium to full body with a lingering buzz. Taste is rich chocolate mingled with apricot, bourbon, vanilla and molasses finishing slightly tart with cranberry. Yum.

22 ounce bottle. Pours dark brown with a nice tan head. Aroma of malt, fruit, bourbon, and chocolate. Taste is roasted malt, dark fruit, bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, caramel, and oak. Excellent as usual.

Bottle shared at the Kenny 20K mega monster tasting. 15/01/2016. Many thanks to the Wingman Dave for this one. Clear dark reddy brown coloured pour with a lasting loose light tan head. Aroma is solvent hot alcohol, spicy Rye bread, jammy fruit, Little veg, . Flavour is composed of rounded bitter black malts, spicy veg, cinnamon, toasted, tangy bitter fruit, coconut, wood. Palate is medium full, tangy, moderate to high carbonation, milky. Nice depth of flavour.

Black waxed bomber from Wegmans. Pours turbid black with tan head that laces well for a beer this huge. Nose is a delicious medley of dark malt, blackberry, cacao, fig, oak, bourbon, hops. Tastes smooth, rich, very complex with notes of cacao, blackberry, bourbon, hops, spice. This one straddles the Beer/wine.spirits triple point with notes of spirity oay bourbon, winey vinous fruit and berry, and RIS dark malt cacao, and hops. This is one hell of a beer.

On tap at Three Four Beer Co. Almost black in appearance with a small, light brown head. Aroma of bourbon, oak, vanilla, fruity esters, chocolate, bread and hints of spice. Similar flavor, complex, thick and rich with a hint of molasses. Medium to full body with a lasting finish. A nice, rich, big time porter overall.

Aroma is deeply roasted malts, toffee, caramel, toffee, fudge and raisins. Taste is caramel, coffee,tart, plum, Belgian sugar and raisins. Finishes smoothly with caramel and butterscotch. Appearance is black with a beige head that retains fairly well. Complex and great.

Black pour with a thin beige head and light lacing .... aroma is of roasted and chocolate malts, apricot, molasses and dark fruity yeast .... taste is of dark fruity yeast, chocolate and roasted malts, apricot, pomegranate, thick molasses and dark berries ... nice meld of chocolate and berries mostly dominate the flavor .... some hints of dry oak to it, but the bourbon barrel is really non-existent .... finish is dry, roasted with a lingering dark fruity yeast ... tasty

Bottle 22fl.oz. @ [ madmitch76 - 20K Tasting ] - chriso & Boudicca House, London. [ As Deschutes Black Butte XXVII ].Dark dark brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, light beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, dark malt, bread, roasted, figs - dried apricot, bourbon notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, dark malt, roasted, bread, figs - dried apricot - pomegranate sweet, light chocolate - cacao, bourbon notes. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20160115]

Bottle share at Kennys 20000, thanks to Dave. As Deschutes Black Butte XXVII, 11.6%, black wax. Blac, small foamy tan head, dotted lacing. Aroma is plastic, surprisingly fruity, some rose water. Body is medium, smooth, low carbonation. Taste is plastic, tangy, spice, boozy bourbon, peppery finish. Perhaps not the most refined beer, but quite tasty.

22oz bottle shared at Kennys 20K celebrations @Chrisos, thanks to Dave. It pours a dark brown color with a medium beige head. Aroma is big sweet with notes of pears and raisins. Taste is sweet with more notes of pear and banana. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, quite tasty

Bottle thanks to Padraig at Kennys 20K tasting. It pours darkest brown with a thick light tan head. The nose is rich roasted malts, chocolate, fudge, creamy coconut, umami, dark fruits and crystallised rose. The taste is rich, plenty of roasted malt, tangy dark fruits, red berry, Eccles cake, chocolate, treacle, alcohol warmth, candied rose petals, burnt notes and charred wood with a slick, warming finish. Full body and fine carbonation. A bit hot perhaps, but very enjoyable in small doses.

Bottle at Happy New Beer in Sätila 160116. Opaque black beer with a nice beige head. Roasted chocolate aroma, licorice, caramel, spicy notes, fruity, spicy notes, some oranges. Roasted chocolate flavor, fruity, caramel, licorice, figs, coffee notes, cocoa, some warming alcohol. Quite nice.

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2016  January 16, 2016. Bottle, shared by tkrjukoff, thanks! 
Black with a small brown head. Aroma is sweet malty and fruity with caramel, molasses, some fruity pomegranates and apricot, bourbon notes, some licorice and chocolate.
Taste is sweet, bitter and a touch of fruity tartness. Finish is bitter roasted with hints if ash, a touch of tart fruitiness 
Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation. 
Good, lots of things going on.

Bomber courtesy of rlgk. Pours viscous black with a creamy pale mocha head that leaves some sprase trace on the glass while dissiapting. Smell is malty and tiny fruity with roasted malts, dark bread, caramel, dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, molasses, caramelized nuts, moist soil and hints of alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter, malty, tiny frutiy and tiny spicy. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny astringent, tiny boozy and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with roasted malts, dark bread, caramel, dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, fruity molasses, moist soil, hazelnuts and hints of alcohol. Solid imperial porter with a prominent fruit presence. Quite like it!
Bottle. Pours ruby black with a small tanned head. Aroma is fruity malty molasses. Flavor is as aroma, good chocolate touch, very fruity which mates well with the dark, good bitterness in finish

A: Pitch black with a nice light brown one finger head. N: coffee, gooseberry, chocolate, apricot, bourbon T: Coffee, chocolate, spices (crazy), smoke O: There is so much going on in this one. I like it, but its hard to find out whats going on in it.
Bottle at Madmitch 20k tasting. Black beer lasting tan head. Some roast. Some toast roast. Its OK if a little one dimensional just too burnt for me. Too roasted for me.
Tasty, though theres no sign of the apricot or pomegranate beneath all the chocolate and bourbon.

Draught at Harrys Hofbrau. Chocolate and vanilla dominate nose with light molasses. Black with ruby highlights and light brown head that leaves only a dusting across the top. Moderate boozy alcohol and bourbon barrel adds a nice complement to the flavor.
Pours dark as night. Has a thin tan head. Aroma of bourbon, kind of oaky. Taste is rich. A lot going on. Hints of cocoa, coffee, bourbon, molasses. Nice warming brew. Well done!

Draft. Black beer with a tan head. Chocolate and bourbon aroma with light vanilla. Chocolate and bourbon flavor with light fruitiness. Medium-plus bodied. Chocolate and bourbon linger with fruitiness.

awesome beer Color is black, but not quite opaque. Light brown head, a bit frothy, good lacing. Aromas: brown sugar, red fruit, light wood, sweet. Also light sourness retronasal. Flavor is moderate sweet, with some fruity sourness. Medium to full bodied. Finishes with roast, moderate bitter. Better with every sip....

Dark black in color, light tan foamy head... Aroma of chocolate, roasted malts, spices... Roasted malts, chocolate with sweetness from apricots and pomegranate, bourbon and vanilla notes... Great beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber poured into snifter. Pours mostly pitch black, but a dark caramel brown near the surface, with a thin khaki head that quickly disappears. A pencil thin collar lingers throughout the drink, accompanied by soapy wet lacing that doesnt stick. Aroma is masterful - coffee, smooth roast, roses, fig, bourbon, plum, hints of vanilla. Taste is a blend of roasted coffee, dark fruits like plum and raisin, bourbon sweetness. A big, bold, delightfully balanced beer.

Bottle, 12/22/2015. Pours a black color, thin light tan head. Aroma of cocoa, molasses, smooth roast, widening out to a fruity puree, pomegranate and fleshy apricot, rose water, bourbon rounding out nicely. Taste is chocolate, fruity notes, balanced by cocoa bitterness, some coffee, mellow caramel with touch of bourbon. Medium body, low carbonation. Nice.
22 ounce bottle on my 46th. Dark with tan head. Creamy and boozy. Chocolate and bourbon. Licorice and berry. Some sticky sweetness. Big beer.
You can definitely taste the bourbon and peaches/apricot, although both are subtle. Smells of roasted malts and peaches.
Tap. Black with small head. Big chocolate malt. Berry notes, light molasses sweetness. Complex and wonderful.
Pours black with a lacy tan head. Aroma is fig. Flavor iis cranberry, plum and toasty malt. Very delicious. Per j as a little bit sweet.

Brown bottle, best after 7/20/16, purchased at Binnys, savoured on December 13 2015; eye: black, opaque, thin sheet of beige head that turns into a ring, light lacing; nose: roasted barley, coffee, small black berries, slight vanilla, light bourbon, chocolate; mouth: roasted barley, coffee, small black berries, slight vanilla, light bourbon, light alcohol, spices, light ashy, chocolate, finale in roasted barley with light presence of burnt barley, full body, average carbonation, mildly bitter, lightly sweet, lightly alcoholic texture; overall: nice fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, meilleure après 7/20/16, achetée chez Binnys, savourée le 13 décembre 2015; il : noire, opaque, petite couverture de mousse beige qui se transforme en un anneau, légère dentelle; nez : orge torréfiée, café, petits fruits noirs, très léger vanille, léger bourbon, chocolat; bouche : orge torréfiée, café, petits fruits noirs, très léger vanille, léger bourbon, âcreté, léger alcool, épices, léger cendré, finale en orge torréfiée avec légère présence dorge brûlée, corsé, carbonatation moyenne, moyennement amère, légèrement sucrée, texture légèrement alcoolique; en résumé : bien

Roasted malts, vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, lightly spice, molasses. Medium bodied. Black pour with a rocky beige head. The finish is very vanilla and molasses with loads of soft booze. Good brew, yo.

Black with slightly brown edges, thin beige head. Aroma of smoke, bourbon, roasted apples/berries, cocoa powder....very appetizing. Full bodied. More whiskey and burnt oak but beautifully paired with chocolate covered raisins. Lingering cocoa finish. Well made, great brew for a cold night and a steak.

Bottle from Berkeley Bowl West. Pours ear black wit a nice tan head and a complex aroma that includes treacle, coffee and fruit. There is a hearty dark molasses flavor with a hint of apricot and a nice chocolate finish

Delicious and extremely complex beer. So complex that you want to contemplate every sip and pick out all the flavors. Aroma was all dark chocolate and dark roasted malt. Pour was a deep dark brown/near black with a thin near tan film for a head. Taste was a lot more complex than the aroma. Molasses, pomegranate and dark chocolate hit first with thick viscous roasted malt and caramel weavin in and out. After the swallow there was a light sweet fruitiness that blended well with the bitter dark chocolate and roasted malt finish. Lots going on here. Nice carbonation .
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Pours a deep brownish black with copper hue from the bomber with bubbly tan head that leaves light lace. Aroma of fruity yeast esters, stone fruit sweetness, and barrel aged vanilla notes. Taste is less on the barrel and more on the fruit, spices are minimal. Really nice, complex, minimal carbonation but where you want it.
Bomber from GM Liquors. Nose is chocolate, vanilla, and a hint of woody bourbon. Black with a medium heavy lacing cinnamon tan head. Flavor is moderately sweet chocolate with bourbon and molasses.

Waxed bomber. Black with a pinkish light brown head. Raspberry, cocoa, bourbon, vanilla, strawberry candy and roasted malt. The sweet tartness of the pomegranate comes through better in the taste with a chocolate, ash finish. Heavy body with a syrupy feel. Very tasty, dessert like beer.

draft that poured almost black with mocha head. savored the aroma of roasted malts, bourbon, hints of vanilla and oak. some sort of dark fruit and chocolate....the flavor is much more of the same. nice chocolate, boubon vanilla, oak, dark fruit...nicely blended throughout..damn this is a good beer now I want my bottle of it...but draft was amazing.
Has a real bourbony nose but tastes a bit to much like molasses. Not really one I cared for as much.
UPDATED: MAY 6, 2016 Spicy and fruits on a massive bold stout. Excellent. Whiskey and chocolate bars with cherries.  Sweet and tasty. Having again in Dubuque at the in laws

Pours dark with a medium beige head. Aroma of dark roast malts, pears, molasses and chocolate. Flavor is very malty with lots of chocolate. Syrupy sweet, but not overly so. Flavor is actually pretty clean.

Bottle. Pours a slightly thinner than expected near-black color with a smallish light brown head on there. Nose immediately hits you with some roasting and subtler bourbon notes; it descends quickly to some lighter reddish fruit elements and a hint of vanilla. Taste is a mix of sweet and quite roasty, with bits of fruitiness coming through. Super smooth finish.

Bomber. Clear dark brown with a thin, tan head that lasts in a spotty ring and laces. Aromas of roasted malt, raisin, plum, bourbon, dark chocolate, vanilla, wood, spice and molasses. Flavor is roasted malt, dark chocolate, raisin, plum, molasses, bourbon, vanilla and spice. Medium plus bodied, creamy and smooth with a slightly warm end.

(bomber) Pours black with a thin ring of tan head around the glass. Aroma is big on apricot, roasted malt, chocolate, and barrel. It comes off as being a little charred and rough though, which is a departure from the seamless barrel to beer iterations of the previous years. Booze is evident. Cherry hard candy and cough syrup. Further warming reveals overripe banana, and even further warming reveals General Tsaos chicken, while further warming reveals the reviled green bell pepper. This just keeps getting worse. Flavor is very sweet and sappy with plenty of chocolate, pomegranate, apricot, char, and oak. Nothing really here to clean up the sweetness and it just kind of hangs there. Mouthfeel is thick and carbonation is toned down. Overall this is pretty disappointing and grossly overpriced considering the quality of the end product.

Black pour with a tight khaki head. The aroma is strikingly fruity compared to the look of the beer. You can smell the alcohol and a note of bourbon. Chocolate is also present as is the stone fruit. Chocolate up front with the fruit next. The flavor finishes with a bit of barrel char smoke and alcoholic heat. Nice massive beer that could probably dial back the alcohol heat a bit. Suitably over the top for a special beer.

Draft. Poured black color with an average frothy brown head that mostly lasted with very good lacing. Moderate to heavy roasted chocolate malt, fruit and alcohol aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy dark sweet flavor with medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate to moderate to long duration. Solid complex beer.
Poured from a bottle at dominion wine and beer it is a dark brown with a slight head. The aroma is bourbon and oak. The taste is a strong sweet smooth bourbon taste with metallic after tones
From a shared bomber at a party. Good chocolate flavor. A bit harsh mouthfeel. Soapy and lots of raw cocoa on the finish. Good depth, but unexceptional, especially for a limited release.

Draft at Tap & Bottle. Dark brown pour with a brown ring; slick looking. Umami and molasses aroma. Big flavor that bounces between a tart and sweet fruitiness and the dark malt. Interesting and the alcohol is expertly hidden.

Bottle, black beer, great almond colored head. Aroma cookies, raisin, molasses, bourbon, chocolate. Taste is vanilla, chocolate, oak, cookies, coffee, cherries. Palate very rich, carbonation moderate. This is a bit sweet for me, but nicely complex.

Waxed bomber from Capitol Beer in Sacramento, CA. Pours dark brn/blk with a creamy tan head. Aroma of chocolate, smooth burnt malt, mixed fruits, wood, bourbon. Full bodied. Flavor is chocolate, wonderful fruits, smooth burnt malt, very smooth bourbon, a little wood, and some fruit so tasty my mouth aches back at the hinges. Not a trace of heat. Nothing harsh. All mellow and smooth. Arguably a little hop bitter, but its not very close to dry - but nowhere near sugary/sticky. Simply amazing.

Bottle, pours clear deep mahogany, medium tan head, decent lacing. Aroma is loads of bourbon, anise, molasses. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, anise, bourbon, chocolate, hints of smoke, light body. Tasty.

Bottle: Very dark brown in color, viscous, and topped with a finger of creamy tan head. The nose is very sweet, reminiscent of chocolate covered fruit. Some barrel notes and hints of the pomegranate. Rich and creamy mouthfeel, very silky and dense. Taste is decadent chocolate, pomegranate, mild hints of the apricot, moderate bourbon barrel notes. Cocoa lingers in the finish with the bourbon sweetness. Nice level of roast, maybe even a hint of smoke, and faint bitters. Really smooth layers of flavor. Excellent.

650 ml bottle. Pours a very dark brown with light tan head. Wonderful aromas of molasses, sweet bourbon, chocolate syrup, and a bit of dark fruit. Flavors of sweetened dark chocolate, vanilla, light coconut, and light bourbon. A bit of heat. Excellent.

On tap at the brewpub - Pours black with a tan head. The aroma has dates, figs, heavy roast, fruitiness, molasses, vanilla and bourbon. It has a medium / full body with semi-sharp carbonation. The taste has heavy roastiness, cocoa nibs, lots of molasses, berries and booze,. The finish is very hot and fusal. Okay, but not for me, or maybe I just need more age on it.
Dark black. Berries. Boozy.  Some fruit i dont recognize. Chocolate. This is not a stout? Heavy. Chocolate. Some wood. Tasted at Elijah Ps Monsters of Beer festival.
Bottle. Dark brown black pour, with a large fizzy tan head. Cocoa, fruity apricots, dry chocolate, booze, notes of bourbon vanilla, and malty. Somewhat light fizzy body for the style. Ok.

Draft to taster at Ei8ht Ball. Pours a dark cola brown color with a medium sized beige head. The aroma and flavor have big dark chocolate character, molasses, dark fruits, bourbon, wood, vanilla, roast, some spices to the finish, good flavor and I will revisit this soon.
Draft at Pour it Black. Pours dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is dark malts, molasses, a touch of smoke. Flavor is delicate for an11% beer. Dark chocolate, apricots, roast. Barrel is very faint.

Black / dark brown in color. Thin. Off white head and lacing. Cool nose, chocolate and stone fruit. Nice taste, light body, chocolate and fruit move rapidly into a bitter chocolate and roasted malt character. Some oak and bourbon in the finish. Apricot adds a cool dimension to this. Yum!
Shared with the wife last night. Full body props up some solid chocolate notes, bourbon, oak, vanilla. Booze burn featured on the finish.

Bottle. Pours murky brown black with a quick khaki sudsy head that fades to a thin wispy film and collar. Aroma is rich roasted malt chocolate bourbon vanilla faint dark fruit like plum pomegranate. Taste is bitter smooth bitter roasted malt chocolate bourbon some wine tannins and cork. Palate is full slick somewhat coating and finishes dry and alcohol is well disguised.
Bottle: Poured a dark brown to black with a tan head. Aroma is sweet with chocolate. Nice spiciness splits up the sweet molasses and chocolate.

650ml bottle pours almost black in color with a finger of light brown head that leaves some spotted lacing on the glass. Aroma is chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, apricot and pomegranate with some light roasted notes. Taste is a fruity and chocolate malty sweetness with the vanilla and some roasted grain notes and bourbon throughout. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Smooth mouth feel considering the ABV. A very well crafted brew for the style, nicely balanced and definitely feels like a porter.

Sample from tap at promotional display. Pours a dark brown to black with little head. Appears a bit oily but not too thick nor too thin. Aroma of Bourbon is prominent but not overpowering. Taste is predominantly of the Bourbon but somewhat smoother than other barrel aged styles Ive tried. Finish is rather smooth and the flavor lingers around a bit. It was OK but not really my style. Ive had worse. Overall it was good and not too harsh if this is what you like.

Bomber to snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a fairly opaque dull dark cola with foamy lighter beige head. Smells of dark malt, cocoa, fruit, vanilla, molasses, oak, and spices. Tastes like it smells with a pleasant medium full-bodied mouthfeel with some mild tartness from the fruit. A bit of bourbon when exhaling through the nose.  Smooth for the abv.  Good beer.

From tap @ 38 Degrees Alehouse. Color is black, but not quite opaque. Light brown head, a bit frothy, good lacing. Aromas: brown sugar, red fruit, light wood, sweet. Also light sourness retronasal. Flavor is moderate sweet, with some fruity sourness. Medium to full bodied. Finishes with roast, moderate bitter. Better with every sip....

probably my favorite BB right out of the gate. While some have needed time (and last years was my least favorite) thisis just fantastic. A little boozier, in a good way, thanks to the amped up percentage in bourbon. Sweet and ever so slight tartness from apricot and pomegranate, and a plethora of coffee, chocolate and roasted malt too. Great sipper!

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2015 22oz bottle, from Dutchs. Labeled 11.6%, best after: 7/20/16. Nearly pitch black color. Thin khaki head, leaving good ropes and ridges of lace. Bigger roast malt, some vanilla, bit of bourbon heat. Dark chocolate, and a really interesting, nice pleasant kind of rich fruitiness. Some of the brightness of the apricot seems mildly noticeable, in a heavily chocolate-covered apricot kind of way. Plenty of dark chocolate here. Bigger body. Kind of crisp, lighter carbonation. Great thicker chewiness to the texture. Mild slick, then finishing off dry quickly, with some pleasant alcohol warmth. Bigger sweet taste but doesnt bother me too much here. Has a nice big satisfying moderate to bigger bitter taste, too. Some pleasant bit of coffee in the aftertaste. Great BA porter.

Bottle. Pours a beautiful opaque black with a nice layer of toffee colored head. Aroma is dark dark roasted malts, chocolate, and an undercurrent of dark fruit. Taste reminds me of a chocolate colored cherry. Burnt malts and wood forward, hint of berries. Interesting balance.

Bottle. Aromas are bakers chocolate, burnt wood, jammy fruit, and light raisins. Tastes like molasses, stone fruit, chocolate, and ashy wood. Great sweet/bitter balance. Subtle bourbon in the finish. The fruitiness mixes surpringly well with the burnt notes. Medium body. Awesome porter.

Bottle. Dark black pour, small ring of carbonation and an aroma of bitter chocolate and hints of stone fruits. Flavor is nicely balanced chocolate, pomegranate, black cherry skins and finishes with a nice sweet aftertastes. Really well done and worth the $12.99/bottle.

Aroma of wet brownie mix with vanilla and a touch of sweetend applesauce, slightest touch of soft sourdough bread, some strawberry jam. Appears like coffee with a thin ring of light caramel foam, spotty lace. Nice bitter sweet balance for a high abv brew that hides the alchohol well, almost tastes like an oreo cookie with maple syrup sweetening it up a bit, there is a light lingering alcohol on the end, a bit of burnt campfire marshmellow. Texture is thick, a bit oily, but still lightly fizzy. Overall, very good, top tier brew.

October 2, 2015 - bottle from Cellars Eagan. Black pour with some head that faded quickly, but left a small collection of bubbles at the edges. Aroma was a nice bourbon and chocolate mix initially. A bit of spice and fruit came out as it warmed. Taste had the bourbon and chocolate, but the mix of fruit and alcohol gave a brandy type flavor that was very good. The spice seemed to come in the finish and was just the right amount.

Black waxed bomber pours with a deep dark body that supports a thin mocha colored head. The aroma offers up chocolate and boozy spirits and then smooth smelling blueberry and concord grape like fruity esters. As it warms some dark roasted malts and molasses sweetened spicy wood join the experience. The taste delivers smooth rich chocolate and boozy bourbon to start. Toward midway notes of sweet berry and prune like fruity esters blend with dark roasted malts and sweetened spicy wood. It remains very chocolate and dark roasted malts and spicy wood right into the finish. Solid.

On tap at Champps in Brookfield. Amazed it is still there a week after event. Great combination; good stuff on tap, without enough fanfare. Black pour nice streaky lacing. Aroma has vanilla, caramel, cocoa and roast. Some fruit presence. Taste is led by the vanilla. Chocolate, caramel and dark fruits show through. Full bodied and a bit hot. Finishes long and bourbon-y. Glad to have a bottle to cellar past the 13 month "age date", but also glad to have had a chance at this. 15.4
Bottle to glass, tan head. Aroma molasses, orange, chocolate. Taste chocolate, thick fruits, slight warming booze. Medium heavy mouthfeel, successful dessert substitute. Enjoy slowly.

Poured from a bomber on 09.26.15. A: Super complex. Bourbon, milk chocolate, pomegranate, cocoa powder, and ripe apricot. A: 2 finger tan head that recedes to a ring and fluff. Black body with some red in the glass. T: Again, very complex. Oak woodiness, dark berry, ripe apricots, milk chocolate, cocoa powder, and bourbon dominate. Spice is subtle. P: Its a touch syrupy. Perfect. O: This is way better than last years edition. There is some tartness, but it is better balanced this time.

Black pour with a slight dark brown around the edges. Khaki head. Tremendous aroma. Bourbon, vanilla, fruity, apricot, tons of chocolate! Flavor is very similar. Slightly hot, but barely. Nice fruit/chocolate/bourbon mix. Not usually a Black Butte Anniversary fan, but this is great!
Bottle. Big and bold with nose of chocolate. Taste follows nose with chocolate in the forefront followed by raisins, dates and a touch of liqueur. Palate is full smooth and creamy. Loved this beast.

The rediscovered greatness here...so many generations that disappointed but this one was a triple if not an inside the park home run! Molasses, oak, vanilla, bourbon, apricot, and cocoa in the nose. Ebony body with a small mocha head that diminishes to a ring but leaving a spattering of lacing inside the glass. Dark, rich, decadent. Chocolate covered peach, maple, soy, and barrel. Complex and delicious!

650ml waxed bottle. Pour is a dull dark black, almost matte, amber brown around the edges, big fluffy tan head that sticks. Aroma is sweet dough, booze, and chocolate covered orange/raisin. Flavor is strong and boozy. Tart fruit character, big bittersweet chocolate, boozy bourbon, herbs, soy. The boozinesss makes it seem thinner and just plain rocket fuelly. Its decent though, not ultra-sweet.

Big dark fruit dominated aroma with plenty of pommegranite, grape, plum raisin, apricot, tons and tons of chocolate, cocoa, toffee, cacoa nibs, powdered chocolate, vanilla, oak,toasted coconut, grape must and subtle spice. Pours black with a very thin brown foam rim and moderate alcohol legs. Taste is very sweet with off chocolate, cocoa nibs, fannie maye dark chocolate, cacao and toffee upfront. Mid palate brings tons of fruity flavors such as raisin, plums, prunes, blackberries, pomegranate, sweet apricot and grape. Finishes with a big malt funk, leather, caramel, oak, and hints of bourbon. Overall, interesting brew with unique flavor. Booze is controlled but definitely noticeable. I taste more red wine flavor than actual bourbon and spices are very subtle. TONS of chocolate.

The appearance is black with a thick, dark tan head that does not want to dissappear. Lacing is outstanding. Aroma consist of chocolate with vanilla and pomegranate notes. Creamy texture. Sour on the palate. Leaves a sweet drawn out finish. Was very suprised by the taste. The aroma throws you a big curveball. Very pleased with this beer.

22 oz bottle shared by ebone1988. We had some great laughs talking about the influence of rose water in the brewing process. Things like how it tickled your olfactory receptors or how your testicles ascended, stuff like that. The pour is a nice light black with a creamy tan head and some soapy lace. The aroma is really fruity. There is a lot of apricot purée and a light roast. The molasses is sweet and there is a little barrel. The toast and char is nice, but I wish there was a little more vanilla. The flavor is a little thin. There is a nice fruitiness but the cocoa nibs are pretty absent. The molasses adds a little more sweet fruitiness but the barrel influence really falls off. The mouth feel is light, but creamy with a nice carbonation and a lingeringly fruity finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with koleminer20 and Gus. Aroma is apricot, roasted malt, floral, some booze but I broke the rules of the bottle by opening this before next July. Appearance is dark brown, light brown head, somewhat thin. Taste is nice, apricot, ROSE WATER, roasted malt, a touch of booze, the barrels become apparent pretty quick. Mouthfeel is a touch thin, but has a good carbonation. Overall, I enjoy this.

Draft. Poured very deep brown with a nice khaki head. The aroma picked up soft vanilla, cocoa, and a touch of cinnamon.. fairly restrained, bit it opened up with time.. fruity on the back of the nose. The flavor found cocoa and a hint of bourbon on the tip of the tongue, with vanilla, darker vinous notes, cocoa, and cinnamon following.. spicy toward the back. Heavier-bodied with moderate carbonation.. really good!

On tap at Red Cow North Loop. Pours black with a creamy chocolate brown head that dissipates slowly to edges. Aroma combines dark grains with chocolate and dark fruits with a hint of roast underlying. Flavor has lots of dark grains, molasses and dark fruit with growing bitter chocolate and a hint of roast.

Bottle from Beermongers. Pours a pitch black color with a small white ring of a head. A big complex nose with wood, bourbon, roast, some chocolates. Molasses, licorice, chocolate, some sweet fruit, bourbon is big initially but mellows. Vanilla. Wheat. Solid very nice beer. Sharp fruity flavors at times. Lovely. Very big.

Wax dipped bomber. Black pour with a sudsy cap of light brown foam. Big notes of roasted malt, molasses, bittersweet chocolate, apricot and bourbon barrel in the aroma. Flavor is dark chocolate syrup, charred malt and dried tart fruit upfront along with some coffee, vanilla bean and toffee toward the end. Mouthfeel is moderately thick and creamy with low carbonation and more toasted oak and chocolate in the finish. As rich, potent and flavorful as the other blends with a nice tartness from the fruit.
Bottle (220z $15): Black with small tan head. Bourbon not too strong.. pretty subtle compared to others. Some chocolate. Good.

Draft at ebp. Pours an opaque black with creamy burnt tan whorls atop. Huge chocolate smoke oak plum prune nose. Goopy thick grabby body with sluggish carb essentially assimilated into the grist. Smoke oak plum prune chocolate goodness mid palate. Long sweet finish. Lovely.
Draft pour at Snallygaster shared by solidfunk, thanks! Black with tan head. Aromas of roast, light smoke, dark chocolate. Tastes of bourbon, oak, light booze, chocolate. Full body with a dry finish.
Draft at Uber, Seattle. Jet black, some warmth. Bigger bubble head. Bubbly carbonation, more soy character. Definitely needs some age. Vanilla-chocolate. Rich, tasty.
Dark black color with small head and messy lacing. Aroma and flavor have nice cocoa, roastyness, light vinous notes, and good bourbon flavor. Very good overall

Draft at Snallygaster 2015. Poured a clear dark brown color with a light tan head. Aroma was chocolate, roasted malts, some vanilla, woody notes. Flavor was light fruity booze notes, roasted, burnt malt. Not as bitter as expected, some molasses. A lot going on here.
On draft at Snallygaster 2015. Pours a clear cola brown with an ecru head, Flavos of chocolate and coffee,
Roast and light citrus. Lots of chocolate. Some cofffee. Pours black with good head and lacing. Bittersweet finish. Tap.

On tap at Bitter Creek Boise black with a thin brief tan head and lacing big chocolate tootsie roll and a little grape jelly. Flavors are similar rich smooth and chocolate Just a little barrel age notes Excellent over all

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, thick black pour with tan head, aroma brought notes of anise, dark chocolate, coffee, caramel, some dark fruit, oak, booze, some slight wine. Taste was a mix of oak, vanilla, dark fruit, cocoa, hints of cherry, touch of brown sugar, bourbon, finishing fairly sweet, slightly boozy. Good, probably better with a couple months on it.

On tap at The Pourhouse, pours black with a small tan head. Aroma brings out lots of sweet pitted fruits, a touch of cocoa and some barrels. Flavour is full-bodied, with sweet fruitiness and cocoa acting in great harmony. Rich and robust. A little boozy but acceptable. Excellent.
Draft - Dark chocolate, cocoa and a slight touch of spice. Jet brown with a light brown head. A bit boozy, touch of cocoa and sweet barrel (could be fruity) notes. Different but nice.
Poured into a tulip at the Portland Brewpub. Sweet and tart cranberry taste. Lots of chocolate and fudge brownies. Nice bourbon and vanilla oak. Excellent!

Glossy black. Big, pillowy tan head. Chocolate and molasses/seafoam candy. The theres something extra. Mild cayenne, and graham crackers. Flavor brings coffee and stone fruit. toward the end. Really nice.

Rake #3? This has been on for a week here - where are all the ticks? Near black pour, mocha head. Lots of fudgy chocolate, caramel and brown sugar. Dont get the fruit or spice so much. Full body, velvety thick texture. Sweet and rich.

On tap at bier thirty. Pours out black topped with a brown head. Nose is great rich roast malts some nice fruit notes molasses chocolate sweetness and some barrel. Taste is great thick rich roasted malts a nice fruit touch and a good balance between bitter and sweet. This one is ready to drink now.

On tap @ Chucks 85th. Pours deep inky blackish brown with a medium thick dark cream-colored head. Aroma is deep rich chocolate malt, bright and tart fruit mid-palate - raspberries, cherries, and pomegranate stand out - and then slightly boozy port note on the back. Taste is similar: rich, dry, oaky malt up front and light juicy fruit on the finish amidst a rich barrel-aged flavor throughout. Much better than XXVI, where the pomegranate flavor was really out of balance.
